Product.name: PAN11 Smart Energy Plug In Switch

Value.label: Watt Meter Report Period
Value.Help: If the setting is configured for 1 hour(set value=720), the device will report its instant power consumption every 1 hour to Z_Wave controller. Unit: 5 secs, Min: 1, Max: 32767, Default: 720

Value.label: KWH Meter Report Period
Value.Help: If the setting is configured for 1hour (set value =6), the PAN11 will report its Accumulated Power Consumption (KW/h) every 1 hour to Group1 node. The maximum interval to report its Accumulated Power Consumption (KW/h) is 227.55 days (10min*32767/1440=227.55 days).

Value.label: Thereshold of current for Load Caution
Value.Help: This is a warning when the current of load over the preset threshold value, if the setting value is 1300, when the load current of Relay1 over this value, PAN11 will send current meter report to warn the Group1 node, the Range of the setting value is from 10 to 1300,and the default value is 1300.

Value.label: Thereshold of KWh for Load Caution
Value.Help: This is a warning when the KWh of load over the preset threshold value, If the setting value is 10000, when the Accumulated Power Consumption of Relay1 over this value, PAN11 will send KWH meter report to warn the Group1 node, minimum value is 1KWh and default value is 10000 kWh.

Value.label: Restore switch state mode
Value.Help: Whenever the AC power return from lost, PAN11 will restore the switch state which could be SWITCH OFF, LAST SWITCH STATE, SWITCH ON. The default setting is LAST SWITCH STATE.

Value.label: Mode of Switch Off function
Value.Help: When the mode of switch On/Off is set to 0, any command of switch off will be disabled and the On/Off function of include button will be disabled. The default setting is enable mode. When manual On/Off function is disabled, the RF command can only switch On but not Off. This is useful function for keeping the device in switch on state.

Value.label: LED indication mode
Value.Help: Show Switch State:When switch is on, LED is on. When switch is off, LED is off. The default setting is Show Switch State. Show Night mode:When switch is on, LED is off. When switch is off, LED is on. One Flash mode:When the state of switch changes, LED will be on only one second, then LED keeps off.

Value.label: Auto off timer
Value.Help: Whenever PAN11 switches to on, the auto off timer begin to count down. After the timer decrease to zero, it will switch to off automatically. However if Auto off timer is set as 0, the auto off function will be disabled. The default setting is 0.

Value.label: RF off command mode
Value.Help: Whenever a switch off command (BASIC_SET, BINARY_SWITCH_SET, SWITCH_ALL_OFF) is received, it could be interpreted as 4 variety of commands. Switch Off: It switches to OFF state. The default setting is Switch Off. Ignore: The switch off command will be ignored. Switch Toggle: It switches to the inverse of current state. Switch On: It switches to ON state.

Group.label: load vary over 5% or stage has changed

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF

Item.label: ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON active / ALL OFF active

Value.label: Auto off relay after specified time
Value.Help: Auto off relay after specified time, with the possibility of manual override - immediate Off after button push. Default value: 0 Manual override disabled

Value.label: Relay 1: OFF-delay time
Value.Help: Automatic turning off relay 1 after set time, (0-255) in 10ms increments for FW1.0 to FW2.0, (0-65535) in 100 ms increment for FW2.1+

Value.label: Relay 2: OFF-delay time
Value.Help: Automatic turning off relay 2 after set time, (0-255) in 10ms increments for FW1.0 to FW2.0, (0-65535) in 100 ms increment for FW2.1+

Value.label: Managing the transmission of control commands to the devices from first group of associations (key 1).
Value.Help: Correct working parameter No. 6 requires settings parameter No. 15 to 1. This activates functionality double-click - Control Dimmer/Roller Shutter. Default setting: 0

Item.label: The control commands are sent when the device is turned on and off (default)

The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to prev.value (ex. 50%)
The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to 100%

Value.label: Managing the transmission of control commands to the devices from second group of associations (key 2).
Value.Help: Correct working parameter No. 6 requires settings parameter No. 15 to 1. This activates functionality double-click - Control Dimmer/Roller Shutter. Default setting: 0

Item.label: The control commands are sent when the device is turned on and off (default)

The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 2 will send ON to all devices in group 2, all dimmers set to prev.value (ex. 50%)
The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 2 will send ON to all devices in group 2, all dimmers set to 100%

Value.label: Inputs behaviour
Value.Help: In case of bi-stable switches, define their behaviour (toggle or follow). Default setting: 0

Value.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
Value.Help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default setting: 1

Value.label: Dimmer/Roller shutter control
Value.Help: Enable/Disable operation of dimmer or roller shutter devices associated to group 1. Available only when using mono-stable inputs (buttons) - Hold button 1 or double-tap for operation (only mono-stable input (button)). Default setting: 0

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure. Default setting: 1

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Relay 1: Response to General Alarm
Value.Help: Default setting: 3

Item.label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Value.label: Relay 1: Response to Water Flood Alarm
Value.Help: Default setting: 2

Item.label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Value.label: Relay 1: Response to Smoke, CO, CO2 Alarm
Value.Help: Default setting: 3

Item.label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Value.label: Relay 1: Response to Temperature Alarm
Value.Help: Default setting: 1

Item.label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Value.label: ALARM FLASHING alarm time
Value.Help: Amount of time (ms) the device keeps on flashing after receipt of Alarm Frame. Default setting: 600

Value.label: Relay 2: Response to General Alarm
Value.Help: Default setting: 3

Item.label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Value.label: Relay 2: Response to Water Flood Alarm
Value.Help: Default setting: 2

ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Value.label: Relay 2: Response to Smoke, CO, CO2 Alarm
Value.Help: Default setting: 3

Item.label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Value.label: Relay 2: Response to Temperature Alarm
Value.Help: Default setting: 1

Item.label: DEACTIVATION - no response to alarm frames
ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush 1 relay module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Automatic turning off relay after set time
Value.Help: 0 => Auto OFF disabled. 1 - 32535 => 1 second (0,01s) - 32535 seconds (325,35s). Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter 15. Default value 0

Value.label: Automatic turning on relay after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 - 32535 => 1 second (0,01s) - 32535 seconds (325,35s). Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter 15. Default value 0

Value.label: Automatic turning on/off seconds or milliseconds selection
Saving the state of the relay after a power failure

Item.label: Flush 1 relay module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush 1 relay module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position.
When system is turned off the output is 0V (NC)
When system is turned off the output is 230V or 24V (NO)

Value.label: Reporting to controller
Value.Help: Available from SW version S1 Only This parameter defines if reporting regarding power level, multilevel, etc, are reported to controller or not. NOTE: Disabling reporting is recommended in case Z-wave modules communicate in association groups without using main controller.

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2 or select notification type and event

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Value.Help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. Available configuration parameters : default value 32536. 32536 offset is 0.0C. From 1 to 100 = value from 0.1C to 10.0C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 = value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Available configuration parameters : 0 = reporting disabled. 1 to 127 = 0,1C to 12,7C, step is 0,1C. Default value is 5 = 0,5C

Group.label: Basic on/off of the output state
Basic on/off of the input I2 state
Binary Sensor Report of the input I2 state
Notification Report of the input I2 state
Basic on/off of the output state
Basic on/off of the input I2 state
Binary Sensor Report of the input I2 state
Notification Report of the input I2 state
